item.title: 🔐 the 2/3 rule for multi-factor authentication
item.description: I propose the "2/3 rule" for multi-factor authentication: to access a system, a user must pass at least two out of three possible methods for authentication. Unlike standard 2-factor authentication, this strategy protects against both false positives (granting access to a hacker) and false negatives (denying access to a legitimate user).
